conclusion: Analyze forces on blocks A and B to find mass ratio.
Block A is on the ground; Block B is pushed horizontally and in contact with A.
Contact surface between A and B is vertical.
Maximum static friction equals sliding friction.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is μ1; between A and ground is μ2.
Identify forces on Block A: frictional force from ground, normal force, weight.
Identify forces on Block B: applied force, frictional force from A, weight.
Condition for Block A to slip: frictional force f_A is maximum.
Maximum static friction for A: f_A = μ2 (m_A + m_B) g.
Condition for Block B to slide: vertical frictional force f_{BA} equals weight of B.
f_{BA} = m_B g and f_{BA} = μ1 F.
Relate forces: μ1 F = m_B g, thus F = m_B g / μ1.
Horizontal forces on A: f_A = μ2 (m_A + m_B) g.
Since B is about to slide, F = f_A.
Equate expressions for F: m_B / μ1 = μ2 (m_A + m_B).
Solve for mass ratio: m_B = μ1 μ2 (m_A + m_B).
Simplify to find m_B (1 - μ1 μ2) = μ1 μ2 m_A.
Final mass ratio: m_A / m_B = (1 - μ1 μ2) / (μ1 μ2).
